comments.body: Yes please. I hate that you can't do this on Bedrock. It has been years now. Please make this a thing.
i agree
these would make building huge beds easy and you could accualy  sleep in them
Great idea! I hope it gets added
This is a great idea just not have it called tiki torch because I think it has racial connotations but maybe ‚Äúengraved/decorated torch‚Äù
I'm conflicted on this
Some hasty statements, maybe we should wait for non-experimental snapshots?
Interesting, but, maybe not Reinforced Deepslate, but some new material that can be found in the Deep Dark biome, which can be used to create Reinforced deepslate?

In my own opinion, I think reinforced deepslate armor and tools is a wonderful idea, but I have some criticisms. First, the fact something is stronger than netherite, a thing literally found in h*ll, is over passed by something that sound worthless, but it's protected by a super boss so I can get pass that one. The second thing is, if reinforced deepslate is supposed to be stronger than netherite why isn't it in the crafting recipe. We had diamonds improved by covering it in netherite, all I'm saying is netherite should be "cover" by reinforce deepslate. Plus I think netherite should have built in fire protection. Thank you for a wonderful game and the opportunity to improve it.

its definitely about time for them to add a new armor and tool set, and they should make a new dimension with the ruined portal in the deep dark. They could use the smithing table with the deepslate shards or whatever, put the netherite object in and the deepslate and boom, you have a new object. kinda like diamond to netherite ( idk if that amde sense or not ) Maybe they could nerf the warden and make it so that it dropped the item you would use to upgrade the netherite??

i think you should use the fragment to craft the upgrade template and use the nether star to upgrade netherite tools into reinforce deepslate tools. Due to the fact that, there is no use for the nether star
I say deepslate should be able to make tougher redstone contraptions. Since sometimes redstone machines get blown up by creepers or TNT and pistons or repeaters get destroyed.
Yes I'm having this exact issue too!
should def have some upside to it like pushing more blocks or somthing like that tho.
Soooooooooooooooo True

I think another good way to balance the copper armor would be if it oxidized and became gradually unusable. I don't really see much use out of the underwater equipment because there's water breathing, turtle helmets, etc. I do definitely think that copper needs to be more useful, good idea!
This could actually be really helpful for multiplayer games/exploring together. It wouldn‚Äôt need to put out a light source. Maybe it could be used on collars to identify pets.
It does not work on dye in PC
Edit: Tipped arrow idea

They should make it brewed from one of the "useless" potions (mundane, thick) instead of awkward potion to add some variety. And the brewing ingredient should be some skulk thing found inside the deep dark city loot chests
Actually, a Potion of Darkness should more appropriately be brewed with an Echo Shard.

Disagree about flower seeds, because one of the few "useful" things that a wandering trader does is selling flowers and other plants from far away places. I don't want them to be even more useless than now.

I've always thought being able to propegate and breed flowers was a big missing feature from Minecraft. I think it should be growable like any other crop! You could put the flowers in the furnace to get the dye and in the workbench to get seeds from them. (Or even better, another bench and profession for villagers: FLORIST! :)
Wasn't this already announced??? I'm not sure.
Yes, this has been announced already. It will come with the swamp update. Who knows how long we'll have to wait for that though.
Dude, it‚Äôs worth implementing
Never doubt your ideas.
A great idea!
it doesnt make sense that in the game is nether brick fence but not nether brick fence gate so this is an good idea
I don't think that having a nether brick fence makes all that much sense in the first place, but if there is a fence there should at least also be a fencegate
2025, its still not in the game </3
Cool but also PLEASE ADD polished andesite,granite and diorite walls
Would be great for adding variety to stone brick walls and castle style builds.
Yes we absolutley need these but maybe with smaller brick sizes in the texture than stone bricks but a bit bigger than deepslate tiles
maybe not pillars. brick would be great though

Chiseled variants should be added too. All chiseled and pillar block variants should be unique. Here is the list I can think of:
red sandstone, sandstone -> cut sandstone(wall), bricks(block, slab, wall), pillar
andesite, granite, diorite -> polished(wall), smooth(block, slab, stair), bricks(block, slab, wall), chiseled, pillar
stone -> pillar
deepslate -> pillar
blackstone -> pillar, maybe gilded version of all variants
nether brick -> pillar
red nether brick -> pillar, chiseled
prismarine -> chiseled, pillar, bricks(wall), smooth(block, slab)
purpur -> chiseled, wall
end stone -> chiseled, pillar
mud brick -> chiseled, pillar
quartz -> wall, bricks(slab, stairs, wall)
tiled versions of them like in deepslate ?
Also, chipped mod has many many more blocks and some blocks can be added to the game.
lol in bedrock if you hit a mob with a fire aspect book it actually sets them on fire

This would be a good way to actually incentivize the location of Woodland Mansions, as currently, raids fulfill everything the Woodland Mansion does. However, it would have to be implemented in a simple, easy-to-understand way.
I would like staves that you could shoot fireballs or lightning from

Potion: Null

negates every status effect, good and bad, meaning harming spammers can't hurt you, but you also can't heal.

this does not translate to being unharmed by enchantments like fire aspect considering that's more relatively kinetic based and not a status effect.

Potion can be upgraded with Redstone in a brewing stand to go from 5:00 to 8:00

I feel like adding that would level out how unfair the game is in favor of magic (specifically harming) users, and could mitigate grief.

To make the Potion you could combine an awkward Potion with clay in a brewing stand.

This should be easily accessible if not the most easily accessible, because some people just don't like dealing with magic and it'd allow people who want to use melee skill a chance to put it to use

Potion: Undying

0:20 can be extended to 1:00 with Redstone

Made by putting a Totem Of Undying in brewing stand with awkward potions

The user is allowed to go down to zero hearts without dying until the timer is up, and if the user is at 0 once the time runs out they with in fact die,

Potion: Wither

Created by applying a wither rose to awkward potions in brewing stand.

More data on it later when balancing is taken into account

Should be stronger and last longer than poison considering how hard it is to obtain, can be nerfed if villagers begin to sell them.

PLEASE! We've received new biomes with unique potential ingredients in both Overworld and Nether. Specifically, would love to see a shrink and/or grow potion. Shrink would get you to 1 block height to fit through those tight spaces, similar to baby villagers. Grow would let you cover more ground and jump two blocks (Swiftness + Leaping II). Imagine these as splash potions on mobs, too.
Noice. This is very simple yet balanced and inovative. I'm looking forward to see this idea implemented in the game. Great Idea!
I've seen your other ideas about glass, and now I found this too lol. Anyway, this is actually the feature that I always wanted for so long, and your idea is very inovative! I wish they add this
Great Idea! It's kinda like frosted glass isn't it? But quite different. I wish they add this
Yes this will give Honeycomb more uses too
That would be awesome ! üéâ ‚õè
yeah ive been wanting this for a while and i think its a good idea.

The biggest problem with this might be the problems with conflicting enchantments. Autosmelt wouldn't mean fortune or efficiency, because either way, mining cobblestone to get normal stone and normal stone to smooth stone would take roughly either less the time it takes to smelt said stone.
A good way to limit it is only letting it be enchanted with fortune 1

It shouldn't be able to stack with silk touch. This should enchantment won't be on an enchantment table. It'll have a 3% chance of generating in a bastion and a 1% chance of generating in the fortress. Of course librarians will sell it. It will be compatible with all tools. Even for plants, breaking a potato will give you baked potato. It also won't stack with mending(or should it idk). This enchantment comes at a cost, you won't get xp when you mine things, though you do get xp when you actually smelt things in a furnace.

theres no point if the armor is easily outclassed within 20 minutes of getting it

 

plus they confirmed no copper or emerald armor

how do you even wear fragile crystals as armor?

this is what you are basically saying

"I want chiseled nether brick armor I think it'd really be a breath of fresh air for the game without overwhelming the game with new ore generation It uses an already existing material to give us a new armor set that could have cool abilities and new texture It would be somewhere between leather and netherite and could even be used to make tools I think it would be really cool please upvote this suggestion"

Mira la esmeralda es una moneda de cambio no van a haber armaduras de eso y el cobre no tiene sentido ser√≠a muy d√©bil y la amatista no tiene sentido donde vas a ver una armadura de amatista son fr√°giles como el cristal como vas a hacer una armadura de eso Pensa en las cosas que publicas por poco vas a querer armaduras de tierra
I personally think this would be a great idea.

I think that sheilds shouldn't absorb 100% of damage so that the higher tiers would have more going for them besides durabillity. As for enchantments, unbreaking and mending should probably be the only ones besides a new enchantment or two. An enchantment similar to thorns would fit well as well as one that deflects projectiles.

All the shields would block 100% of damage, but the tier level of a shield would determine how much of you it protects.

A wooden shield can only protect the front and can be disabled with swords, while a Netherite shield would protect the sides and front of a player and can only be disabled with a Diamond or Netherite axe.
Minecraft add this
This is one of the things we‚Äôve always wanted
it should generate in rivers too
This is already announced, actually. The biome vote for swamps was going to add them
Love the idea of sinking in the mud!

I wish they made mud like powdered snow with sinking (more than the feet) keep it 1 block deep so you can walk around the swamp, it slows you down a little, and randomly there are deeper spots more than 1 block deep so you can drown. Wearing leather boots will allow you to walk on it without sinking so there is another reason to keep them in your inventory (or adventuring shulker /bundle).
Yes exactly! But make it harder to get out of than powdered snow (since it's way thicker than snow).
We already have redstone.
Redstone is electricity. Lightning Rods have a connection to redstone.
There is no need for renewable energy sources in minecraft as things that can power redstone can power it infinitely

Redstone Devices' main purpose isn't really to generate power, they are to give power when certain events are measured. Wind and water mills would be useful if wind and water could change states when certain events happened, such as during a storm. Coal Generators would not be useful as they wouldn't measure events and just take up resources to power things when you just need a stick and a piece of cobblestone to make a lever that infinitely powers things
I think it will be a good idea to add electric
Maybe 1 block per 2 string, so it is less OP, also, it should only attach to specific blocks.
Roma
nah maybe more of a lead arrow like a grabling hook but you shoot using a crossbow or a bow
this is such a good idea. I was trying to do it after I made a bundle for the only reason of using it to hold potions, and seeing it not work was a bummer
It would make the bundles useful instead of useless
Glass bottles clanking around is bound to make your sack soggy

OR, there could be this current bundle and other kind of bundle/sack for potions specifically, taking up any kind of potion with some capacity, main issue with potions being mostly not worth carrying for healing or as weapon (for me at least) is that they cant be stacked at all, this "potion bundle" could also work on soups from bowls
being at it, having some "tool sack" could carry multiple pieces of same tool or tools in general, making early game less annyoing with frequent lose of tools and requirement to return to base all the time or having five pickaxes in inventory
letting normal bundles just having special exception to some unstackable items could be issue or it not work by usual pattern and only confusing new players while having special bundle for potions could solve potion issue as well and not confuse anything, this potion bundle could be acquired solely by killing witches or bough from wandering traders, both of those be frequent potion users and supposedly need to carry potions with them, making also wandering trader more useful

This should be a noBrainer. Carrying potions pre shulkers is very annoying and not really an option when out exploring. Making them stackable to 16 in bundles would be a great way of making them actually useful before you're all geared up with full Netherite.
I like your idea on the different colour but I thought that each enchantment could have a different colour, For example: Frost Walker could be blue like ice.

yes but with a new enchantment, it must also have its disadvantadges, i'd say, with Forge 1 you get a 25% chance of taking an extra durability point away, so for example:

Forge II: 25% chance extra 1 durability removal

Forge II: 100% chance extra 1 durability removal

Forge III: 100% chance of 3 points of durability removal

 

Also, i think it should be like a 95% chance of it dropping the ore's correspondent ingot with forge III, so there are mostly always a few leftover ore blocks after a bit of mining.

also, we could go to forge V so it would be way harder to get this enchantment to lvl 5 for a 95/100% chance of an ore dropping its correspondent ingot when mined with a forge III/V pickaxe.

i think this should only work on ores, or it would be too unbalanced, keep in mind, this should be really hard to et the enchantment to maximum level.

Greetings, 

Ender
This update makes minecraft sleeping much more advanced
Perhaps not a Teddy Bear but some generic stuffed animal that Mojang can make merchandise out of ;)
Fantastic idea üí°

I 100% want this. Maybe a sub-update kinda thing where it was a feature in like an end update maybe a sky update that adds the aether and my personal favorite outer-space update that could add a meteor and space ship. (I am getting off topic sorry)
